startup_test.details: Application starts successfully without errors. pygame-ce initializes correctly with display 600x800 and mixer subsystems.

basic_functionality_tests.details: Pygame window created successfully with title 'Vector Galaxian Swarm Attack'. Display mode set to 600x800 resolution as specified.
Main game loop runs at target 60 FPS. Clock.tick(FPS) properly regulates frame timing.
Player ship spawns at correct position (bottom center of screen, x=300, y=750). Player attributes initialized correctly (width=40, height=20, speed=5).
60 enemies spawned in 6 rows x 10 columns grid. Formation correctly initialized with 2 rows each of Flagships (top), Emissaries (middle), and Drones (bottom). Enemies positioned with proper spacing.
50 background stars initialized with random positions, speeds (0.5-2.0), and brightness (100-255). Parallax scrolling effect implemented.
Event handling system operational. Arrow keys and WASD mapped for player movement. SPACE key fires bullets. ESC key properly quits game.
Player moves left/right at speed of 5 pixels per frame. Movement properly clamped to screen boundaries. Both arrow keys and A/D keys functional.
Player can fire bullets with SPACE key. Maximum 2 active bullets enforced. Bullets travel upward at 10 pixels per frame. Bullet rendering works with cyan fill and white outline.
Enemies in formation perform sine wave sway animation using pygame.time.get_ticks() for smooth motion.
Individual enemies randomly initiate dives after timer expires (2-8 seconds). Dive paths use quadratic Bezier curves for smooth arc motion toward player position.
Flagship-led escort dives trigger every 5-10 seconds. Flagship selects 1-2 Emissaries as escorts that follow dive pattern with offset positions.
Emissaries and Flagships fire bullets while diving toward player. Bullets calculated with proper trajectory vector toward player position. Enemy bullets have red fill with orange outline.
Player bullet to enemy collision detection using pygame.Rect.colliderect(). Enemies properly removed when hit. Score increments based on enemy type and state (formation vs diving).
Enemy bullet to player collision detection functional. Player has 2-second invulnerability period after being hit. Lives decrease when hit.
Player to enemy body collision detection works. Same invulnerability system applies for body contact as projectile hits.
Points correctly awarded: Drone formation=30, Drone diving=60, Emissary formation=50, Emissary diving=100, Flagship=150. Escort bonus of 300 points awarded when Flagship with 2+ escorts destroyed.
Explosion particles created at enemy destruction location. Large explosions for Flagships, standard for others. Alpha transparency fade-out effect implemented.
Player starts with 3 lives. Lives displayed in top-right corner with both numeric and ship icons. Game over when lives reach 0.
3 waves total. New enemies spawn after 2-second delay when wave cleared. Victory achieved after completing all 3 waves.
Score, wave number, and lives displayed in top corners. Game over overlay with final score. Victory overlay displayed on completion. All fonts render correctly.
Proper state management for playing, game over, and victory states. Input handling adapts based on current state (SPACE restarts game on game over/victory).
Application exits cleanly when ESC pressed or window closed. pygame.quit() called properly. No resource leaks detected.

strengths: Well-structured object-oriented design with separate classes for Player, Enemy, Bullets, Explosion, Star
Proper use of dataclasses and enums for type safety
Bezier curve implementation for smooth enemy dive paths
Clean state management for enemy AI (formation, diving, returning states)
Escort system for coordinated flagship attacks
potential_improvements: Sound effects not implemented (pygame.mixer initialized but no audio files loaded)
No difficulty scaling between waves (same enemy count and speed)
Could use sprite groups for optimized collision detection

known_limitations: Requires display server for rendering (headless mode not supported)
Game designed for keyboard input only (no controller support)
Fixed resolution of 600x800 (no fullscreen or resolution scaling)
conclusion: The Vector Galaxian Swarm Attack game successfully launches and all core functionality works as designed. The game implements all the features described in appinfo.json including player movement, shooting, enemy formation with diving AI using Bezier curves, collision detection, scoring system, and wave progression. The application is stable, runs at target 60 FPS, and cleanly shuts down. No runtime errors or critical bugs were detected during the 60-second test period.
